DataElement.preferredName: Person Lymphoma MYC And BCL2 Gene Rearrangement And/Or BCL6 Gene Rearrangement Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether a person's lymphoma is MYC and BCL2 gene rearrangement and/or BCL5 gene rearrangement(s).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Lymphoma MYC Gene Rearrangement And BCL2 Gene Rearrangement And Or BCL6 Gene Rearrangement
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A malignant (clonal) proliferation of B- lymphocytes or T- lymphocytes which involves the lymph nodes, bone marrow and/or extranodal sites. This category includes Non-Hodgkin lymphomas and Hodgkin lymphomas.:A molecular abnormality indicating rearrangement of the MYC gene._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._A molecular abnormality indicating rearrangement of the BCL2 gene._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._A molecular abnormality indicating rearrangement of the BCL6 gene.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant (clonal) proliferation of B- or T- lymphocytes which involves the lymph nodes, bone marrow and/or extranodal sites.  This category includes Non-Hodgkin's lymphomas and Hodgkin's lymphomas. -- 2003

Concepts.definition: A malignant (clonal) proliferation of B- lymphocytes or T- lymphocytes which involves the lymph nodes, bone marrow and/or extranodal sites. This category includes Non-Hodgkin lymphomas and Hodgkin lymphomas.

ReferenceDocuments.name: PQT
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the participant's lymphoma categorized as double-hit or triple-hit lymphoma (rearrangement of MYC and BCL2 and/or BCL6 genes)?
